trans-unit.source: Represents a column type for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control that allows you to customize the layout of controls in the column.
Use the TemplateColumn column type in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control to create a column with a customized control layout.

You can provide a custom appearance for the heading section, the footer section, and the items section of the column by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn.HeaderTemplate%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn.FooterTemplate%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn.ItemTemplate%2A> properties, respectively.
You can also control how an item being edited is displayed in the TemplateColumn object by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn.EditItemTemplate%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn> class.
Gets or sets the template for displaying the item selected for editing in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn"></xref> object.
Use the EditItemTemplate property to control the appearance of the item selected for editing in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn> object.
The appearance is specified by creating a template that defines how the item is rendered in the column.
To specify a template for the item selected for editing, first place opening and closing `<EditItemTemplate>` tags between the opening and closing tags of the `<TemplateColumn>` element.
You can then list the content that controls the appearance of the item between the opening and closing `<EditItemTemplate>` tags.
The content can be as simple as plain text, or it can be made more complex by embedding other controls in the template.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref>-implemented object that contains the template for displaying the item being edited in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn"></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, which indicates that this property is not set.
Gets or sets the template for displaying the footer section of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn"></xref> object.
Use the FooterTemplate property to control the appearance of the footer section in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn> object.
The appearance is specified by creating a template that defines how the item is rendered in the column.
To specify a template for the item selected for editing, first place opening and closing `<FooterTemplate>` tags between the opening and closing tags of the `<TemplateColumn>` element.
You can then list the content that controls the appearance of the item between the opening and closing `<FooterTemplate>` tags.
The content can be as simple as plain text, or it can be made more complex by embedding other controls in the template.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref>-implemented object that contains the template for displaying the footer section of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn"></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, which indicates that this property is not set.
Gets or sets the template for displaying the heading section of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn"></xref> object.
Use the HeaderTemplate property to control the appearance of the heading section in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn> object.
The appearance is specified by creating a template that defines how the item is rendered in the column.
To specify a template for the item selected for editing, first place opening and closing `<HeaderTemplate>` tags between the opening and closing tags of the `<TemplateColumn>` element.
You can then list the content that controls the appearance of the item between the opening and closing `<HeaderTemplate>` tags.
The content can be as simple as plain text, or can be made more complex by embedding other controls in the template.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref>-implemented object that contains the template for displaying the heading section of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn"></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, which indicates that this property is not set.

Calls a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell"></xref> object's base class to initialize the instance and then applies a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> to the cell.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell"></xref> object that represents the cell to reset.
The column number where the cell is located.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the template for displaying a data item in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn"></xref> object.
Use the ItemTemplate property to control the appearance of a data item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn> object.
The appearance is specified by creating a template that defines how the item is rendered in the column.
To specify a template for the item selected for editing, first place opening and closing `<ItemTemplate>` tags between the opening and closing tags of the `<TemplateColumn>` element.
You can then list the content that controls the appearance of the item between the opening and closing `<ItemTemplate>` tags.
The content can be as simple as plain text, or can be made more complex by embedding other controls in the template.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref>-implemented object that contains the template for displaying a data item in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateColumn"></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, which indicates that this property is not set.
